sen.j: 鰻飯（うなぎめし）は、飯の上にウナギの蒲焼を乗せた日本料理の一種である。
sen.e: Unagimeshi is a term used to refer to a Japanese cuisine which comes with broiled eel on top of rice.
Unagimeshi is a term used to refer to a Japanese cuisine that comes with broiled eel on top of rice.
Unagimeshi is a term used to refer to a Japanese cuisine that comes with broiled eel on top of rice.

sen.j: 用いる食器によって、大まかには鰻丼と鰻重に分けられる。
sen.e: It is roughly devided into unadon and unaju depending on the container used when it is served.
It is roughly devided into unadon and unaju depending on the container used when it is served.
It is roughly divided into unadon and unaju depending on the container used when it is served.

sen.j: 食べる前にタレをかけ、薬味としては山椒の粉を振りかけるのが一般的である。
sen.e: It is common to pour sauce on the eel and sprinkle Japanese pepper powder as a spice before eating.
It is common to pour sauce on the eel and sprinkle Japanese pepper powder spice on the eel before eating.
It is common to pour sauce on the eel and sprinkle Japanese pepper powder spice on the eel before eating.

sen.j: 鰻飯は本来「鰻丼飯（うなぎどんぶりめし）」の略で、鰻丼と同じものを指していた。
sen.e: Unagimeshi originally used to be a short term for 'unagi donburi meshi' which equaled to unadon.
Unagimeshi originally used to be a short term for 'unagi donburi meshi' which the same as unadon.
Unagimeshi originally used to be a short term for 'unagi donburi meshi' which the same as unadon.

sen.j: これは近世風俗史の基本文献とされる『守貞謾稿』に記されている。
sen.e: There is a record of this in 'Morisada Manko,' which is said to be a basic literature on the modern history of people's lives.
There is a record of this in 'Morisada Manko,' said to be basic literature on the modern history of people's lives.
There is a record of this in "Morisada Manko," said to be basic literature on the modern history of people's lives.

sen.j: ただし同資料が編纂された当時、そもそも重箱に入った鰻飯が存在しなかったことは考慮に入れる必要がある。
sen.e: However, it must be taken into account that there were no such broiled eel rice loaded in laquered boxes when the reference book was compiled.
However, it must be taken into account that there were no such broiled eel rice in laquered boxes when this reference book was compiled.
However, it must be taken into account that there were no such broiled eel rice in lacquered boxes when this reference book was compiled.

sen.j: また鰻重を「重箱に入れたもの」ではなく「飯の下にも鰻を敷いて重ねたもの」とする地域・店舗もある。
sen.e: In some areas, or some individual shops, unaju does not mean 'what is filled in a laquered box,' but it means 'what comes with two layers of eel, that is, under the rice, as well.'
In some areas, or some individual shops, unaju does not mean 'what is filled in a laquered box,' but rather 'what comes with two layers of eel, that is, the rice underneath, as well.'
In some areas, or some individual shops, unaju does not mean 'what is filled in a lacquered box,' but rather 'what comes with two layers of eel, that is, the rice underneath, as well.'

sen.j: 詳細は「鰻丼」「鰻重」を参照の事。
sen.e: See 'unadon' and 'unaju' for further information.
See 'unadon' and 'unaju' for further information.
See 'unadon' and 'unaju' for further information.

sen.j: 鰻飯は「まんめし」とも読まれる。
sen.e: Unagimeshi is also called 'manmeshi'.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Unagimeshi is also called 'manmeshi.'
Unagimeshi is also called 'manmeshi.'

sen.j: それは近畿方言でウナギを意味する「まむし（まぶし）」の語源となったとされる（異説もある）。
sen.e: It is said that the term has become the origin of the word 'mamushi' or 'mabushi,' the Kinki dialect that means eel (there is a different opinion).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is said that the term has become the origin of the word 'mamushi' or 'mabushi,' the Kinki dialect that means eel (there is a different opinion).
